page.title: 05WRINGTON ARCHITECTURE
page.content: THE HEART OF WRINGTON IS THE SHORT, BROAD, HIGH STREET, RUNNING EAST-WEST. ALTHOUGH BUILDING ON EACH SIDE OF THE ROAD IS ALMOST CONTINUOUS THE HOUSES, MANY OF WHICH ARE NOW SHOPS, WERE OBVIOUSLY BUILT INDIVIDUALLY, THOUGH ALL ARE OF THE SAME EARLY NINETEENTH CENTURY STYLE. MANY OF THE BUILDINGS ARE TERRACES OF THREE STOREYS WHICH ARE NOW NEATLY PAINTED. MOST OF THE MORE RECENT DEVELOPMENT OF WRINGTON IS ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE VILLAGE. IN THIS AREA AND ALSO ON THE NORTHERN SIDE NEAR THE CHAPEL SOME NEW HOMES ARE PRESENTLY BEING BUILT. COMMUTER DEVELOPEMENT HAS, THOUGH BEEN LIMITED BECAUSE OF POOR ROAD ACCESS TO THE VILLAGE. TWO OF THE MOST NOTEWORTHY BUILDINGS IN WRINGTON ARE THE PLOUGH INN AND THE CHURCH.
